intro: Sloanea brachystyla, commonly known as the short-styled sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the cloud forests of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
